meanings.definition: To make a low, continuous humming sound
meanings.sent1: The bees buzzed around the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The old refrigerator buzzed softly in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was so quiet that even a tiny fly buzzing would be heard.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the air buzzed like a live wire waiting to spark.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the distant motorbike buzzed in the still night.

meanings.definition: To be under the influence of alcohol or drugs
meanings.sent1: After a few drinks, he felt buzzed and happy.
meanings.sent2: She decided not to drive because she was feeling buzzed.
meanings.sent3: The catnip made the cat act as if it was buzzed on cat cocktails.
meanings.sent4: The music was so good that it made everyone feel buzzed with joy.
meanings.sent5: The laughter and chatter in the room made it feel like a buzzed party.
